column4: How do I set it so that network shares and mounted devices do not get shown on my desktop?
you can mount them in /mnt and they won't show on the desktop
either mount them at /mnt or make directories in /mnt
Why does /mnt make the difference - It's an easy solution, just curious...
But what if it's a networked drive - how do i mount drives in /mnt then?
Eh, it's really not much of an issue, actually a few less keystrokes...was just curious. =]
you can still mount network drives in /mnt
what kind of network drive is it? ... i'm going to make sure you get helped!
so i could edit /etc/fstab or is there a way to mount it via terminal smbmount?
external maxtor on an ubuntu server.
you can mount via terminal... use /hostname/sharedfolder i believe
your server's running ubuntu? Then why not use NFS instead of Samba?

same way I'd suppose.
samba is horrible for nautilus.. (more like nautilus just acts up with samba)

there are some great guides and examples if you look on google
